sections.title: Keep your whitening results steady
sections.body: Whitening top-ups are short booster phases used after an initial course to maintain brightness over time. The need for top-ups varies — it depends on your starting shade, diet, staining habits, and how long you’d like the result to stay at a particular level. We’ll explain sensible intervals and how to avoid overuse, because more gel isn’t necessarily better and can increase sensitivity. If you already have custom trays, we can advise on appropriate gels and protocols; if not, we’ll assess your teeth and gums first. We’ll also discuss how top-ups interact with existing crowns or composite edges to keep your smile looking even.
bullets: Tray checks to confirm fit before supplying gel
Top-up cadence tailored to coffee, wine, or lifestyle factors
Advice on timing with hygiene or other cosmetic steps
Monitoring to keep shade within a natural range

sections.title: A quick check before any refresh
sections.body:
Before we recommend a top-up, we check there isn’t anything that could make whitening uncomfortable
or ineffective — exposed dentine, untreated decay, leaking fillings, or gum recession. It’s a calm,
dentist-led assessment so your plan stays safe, effective, and aligned with your goals.

Recommendations are made by the dentist overseeing your whitening, not a generic protocol.

If tooth shape, alignment, or visible restorations are part of the concern, we’ll explain other options
alongside top-ups so you can choose the right next step.
bullets: Confirm your current shade and the result you want to maintain.
Identify sensitivity triggers and address any issues first.
Check existing trays for fit and suitability before supplying gel.
Set a conservative top-up plan with clear intervals.

items: Book a review and shade check

sections.strapline: Top-ups are calibrated to your lifestyle so results stay natural, not artificial.

faqs.question: How often should I top-up?
faqs.answer: Most patients refresh once or twice a year, often after hygiene visits. We tailor the schedule to your habits and starting shade.

faqs.question: Can I reuse my old trays?
faqs.answer: Yes, provided the fit is still secure. We’ll check for wear or gaps before supplying gel.

faqs.question: Will I need stronger gel each time?
faqs.answer: Usually not. We stick to safe, regulated strengths and keep to the smallest effective dose for your goals.
